page.title: 02Housing, Great Orton
page.content: Originally an iron chain went across the adjoining road and was locked every night. This was a defence against the invasion of the Scots of moss troopers. Once the village had its own pond but this has now been filled in and is used as a childrens' play area. Great Orton is a long, pleasant village with houses placed mainly along both sides of the main road. There are 3 small housing estates. The Main Fauld estate is situated on the outskirts of the village and consists of 6 semi- detached houses built towards the end of the 1939-45 war. These have recently been modernised. The Custy Steps estate was built 1958-9. It is situated in the centre of the village and is shaped like a semi-circle.There is a large grassy area in front of the houses.
